message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a method for salient object detection using a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches. This involves using a CNN-based image classifier and fast bottom-up saliency approaches to produce saliency maps, which are then combined and refined through a multi-scale superpixel-averaging of saliency map. The paper also evaluates the proposed method on seven challenging datasets and compares the results with 36 closely related approaches across 4 different applications. Given the focus on computer vision and machine learning techniques, as well as the use of CNN-based image classifiers, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.MM (Multimedia), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), as these areas are also relevant to the proposed method and its evaluation.
